attributes.action: Stop the PIP Dept of the DWP challenging the decisions of a Tribunal.
attributes.additional_details:
After the PIP Medical, I was awarded Standard Rate Care. Despite a Mandatory Reconsideration, & a Tribunal which awarded me Standard Rate Mobility, the PIP Dept has the right to CHALLENGE the decision made by the Tribunal. 

I know I'm not alone in this situation, & that it's a stressful enough time, without wondering if your award is still going to be there when the PIP Dept have done with it!! 

Please sign, share & let's get our voices heard & acknowledged by those in Parliament.
attributes.background: Before DLA was reclassified as PIP, I had had a Motability car for 7yrs, & received High Rate Care & Mobility. Then I had to reapply for my DLA, now PIP. I lost everything, despite my Disabilities worsening & needing a wheelchair permanently.

rejection.details: We don't understand what you mean when you refer to DWP's right to challenge a Tribunal decision. A Tribunal decision is like any court decision in the UK, and has a clear appeals procedure. A First Tier Tribunal decision can only be overturned by the Upper Tribunal through an appeal.
